III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Visitation and family time; in person contact
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12421
Section • (4) An agency shall facilitate in-person contact between
Description siblings who are not placed together except when there is a
court determination that contact is detrimental to either
child.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency is not permitting sibling visits for a foster youth. The
agency has been made aware of these concerns and has not
responded.
Investigation Aunt was interviewed via telephone on 8/9/2024 and
9/13/2024. She stated Foster Child A had been placed with her
since 10/25/2023. She reported Foster Child A is medically fragile
and requires around the clock care and supervision.
Regarding visitation, Aunt stated Foster Child A, (FCA) has five
maternal half siblings. She reported two of FCA’s siblings were
adopted by a maternal relative prior to FCA’s birth. She reported
FCA has three other siblings, who are adopted and live with their
Maternal Grandmother. She reported the male sibling of FCA is
now in a private facility per his behaviors with Maternal
Grandmother and an active investigation by Department of Health
and Human Services (DHHS) is occurring at the Maternal
Grandmother’s home.
Aunt reported there is an active investigation with DHHS going on
in her home as well regarding medical neglect of FCA. She
reported a Team Decision Making (TDM) meeting was held on
7/29/2024 with all of DHHS workers associated with the case and
Judson Foster Care Worker and supervisor. Aunt stated she did
not attend this meeting because FCA was removed from her care
on 7/26/2024 due to the allegations. She said when she received
the allegation, she informed the worker to come and remove FCA.
She reported she missed medical appointments due to
transportation issues, and her support person (Maternal
Grandmother) could no longer help with FCA because of the
active investigation occurring in the Maternal Grandmother’s
home, her employment schedule and she just forgot some of the
2

medical appointment dates. Aunt blamed FCA’s Foster Care
Worker for not assisting her with transportation. She said she had
already lost one job because of FCA’s needs and that FCA was
creating problems in her marriage. She reported it was best that
DHHS remove FCA.
Aunt reported she is a registered nurse, and she would never put
FCA’s health in danger and that she knew what doctor
appointments to not miss for FCA. She said FCA as of date still
was not receiving visits with her siblings. Aunt reported she never
discussed sibling visits with Judson Center because the agency
never asked her about FCA’s siblings, and she did not volunteer
any information to Judson Center. The Aunt did say when she
went to visit Maternal Grandmother, FCA would see her siblings
that was adopted by their Maternal Grandmother. She did not
discuss how often these visits occurred.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed on 8/9/2024,
9/13/2024 and 10/9/2024. She reported Judson Center has full
family responsibility for FCA. She said FCA was born on
7/18/2023 and placed with Judson on 8/24/2023. She said FCA
was released from the hospital as an MCI ward. She said a
relative came forth and FCA was placed with her Aunt on
10/25/2023. The CA reported there were no siblings identified on
FCA’s foster care case. She said according to MiSACWIS, FCA
had no siblings in care, and this is still the case. The CA
explained that once FCA was removed from Aunt and no longer
had access to freely visit her family, this is when Judson became
aware that some of FCA’s siblings were in foster care now, and
that was when the agency arranged visits among the siblings.
The CA clarified the agency was aware that FCA had siblings
but was unaware that she had siblings in foster care and under
the supervision of the department. She said FCA’s Biological
Mother had previous terminations, but none of FCA’s siblings
were in care. She said FCA was placed with Aunt and FCA was
able to visit with whoever she wanted to visit with, if the siblings
were adopted within the family.
The CA reported she learned FCA had siblings in care who were
under DHHS supervision, when Judson was informed by DHHS
there was an active DHHS investigation under Aunt. CA reported
after Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) informed Aunt that FCA would
need to be remove pending the DHHS investigation of her home
3

on medical neglect, Aunt told FCS to come and remove FCA from
her home.
Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) was interviewed on 8/9/24 and
10/9/2024. She reported the same information as the CA. She
added she went to Aunt’s home with FCW and DHHS Worker on
7/26/2024 to complete a wellbeing check on FCA. Aunt would not
allow the workers into her home. FCS said finally Aunt allowed
the workers into her home and told them to remove FCA from her
because she did not want her anymore. FCS said FCA was
removed and placed in an unrelated licensed foster home on
7/26/2024.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed on 9/13/2024. She did not
add any additional information regarding FCA. She did state
anytime Aunt requested anything; the agency assisted her. She
said Aunt never discussed anything about having a hardship with
transportation. She reported that she and Aunt never discussed
FCA’s having siblings.
DHHS Worker was interviewed on 9/13/2024. She reported an
investigation was open on Aunt’s home due to missing numerous
medical appointments. She reported she did not investigate
anything regarding sibling visits. DHHS Worker stated Aunt did not
mention anything to her about sibling visitations.
Documentation reviewed:
• FCA’s case file and medical history was reviewed. FCA
was removed from her birth mother on 8/24/2023 and
placed in a relative placement with her Aunt. FCA was
hospitalized on 10/25/2023 at Children’s Hospital due to
health issues. She was discharged and placed back in the
care of her Aunt on 1/15/2024.
• TDM meeting held on 7/26/2024. It was decided by the
team FCA be removed from her relative and placed in a
foster home and remain in this foster home pending the
DHHS investigation. It was noted Aunt did not attend this
TDM meeting.
• DHHS special investigation report dated 8/22/2024. The
report stated concerns regarding potential child abuse
and/or neglect. FCA does not have any unmet medical,
mental health, or safety needs.
Analysis After conducting interviews and reviewing Foster Child A’s
MISACWIS case file, the agency is found in compliance with this
rule. FCA’s siblings were not in care and/or under the supervision
of DHHS therefore, no visitation plans were required. Adopted
4

siblings who are not currently under the care and supervision of
the department do not fall under DCWL purview.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
